item.title: NVMe Boot in Proxmox on Older BIOS
item.author: contact@johnhollowell.com (John Hollowell)
item.description: Trying to boot off an NVMe drive on older hardware can cause some issues. If you are running an older BIOS/UEFI, it may not have the needed drivers to understand how to talk to a NVMe drive. I ran into this exact issue when trying to boot my Dell R510 from an NVMe drive. To boot from NVMe, I would need to use some shim which could be booted by the BIOS which would chain-boot the actual OS on the NVMe.
